alert.note: Alert for Collin; Fannin; Hunt (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 28 at 5:22PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Hunt, northeastern Collin and southern Fannin Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 522 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Princeton, or 10 miles north of Wylie, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... McKinney, Bonham, Princeton, Farmersville, Leonard, Lowry Crossing, Wolfe City, Celeste, Ector, Trenton, Bonham State Park, Merit, Randolph, Blue Ridge, Nevada, Josephine, New Hope, Ladonia, Bailey and Westminster. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for north central Texas.
